did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The Mary Roby Papers (1927-2012) contain biographical materials, documents detailing the history of women’s athletics at the University of Arizona, and papers outlining Mary Roby’s leadership roles within the athletics department at the University of Arizona. Additional items in the collection include numerous photographs, awards, and memorabilia. These documents and photographs detail her legacy as an athletic administrator and pioneer of women’s competitive athletics at the university from 1959-1989.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mary Roby was born in Miami, Arizona in 1926. She was a member of the Chi Omega sorority as an undergraduate student at the University of Arizona where she majored in Physical Education, graduating with a Bachelor of Science in 1948. She attended Smith College where she earned a Master of Science in Physical Education in 1949. Mary Roby graduated from the University of Southern California in 1971 with a Ph.D. in Physical Education with a concentration in sports history and administration.

She began her career as a physical education teacher and athletics coach at the University of Texas in 1949. In 1959, she accepted a position as Physical Education Instructor, Director of the Women’s Recreation Association, and athletics coach at the University of Arizona. She was an athletics administrator at the University of Arizona for 30 years, retiring in 1989.

During her tenure at the University of Arizona, Mary Roby was named the first Director of Athletics for Women in 1972 and became Associate Athletic Director for men’s and women’s athletic programs in 1982. She was a full professor in the Department of Exercise and Sports Sciences and propelled women’s athletics at the University of Arizona from intramural sports to the Intermountain, Western Collegiate Athletic Association, Pacific-West and Pacific-10 Conferences. She served on many committees at the conference level, including as Chair of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Women’s Committee on Committees from 1985-1986 and Pacific-10 conference Vice President from 1987-1988. As a professor and administrator, Mary Roby published and presented at the national, regional, state and university level. She was married to Fred Roby, a professor emeritus in the Department of Exercise and Sports Sciences at the University of Arizona.

Mary Roby received numerous awards and honors in recognition of her leadership role in women’s athletics. She was inducted into the University of Arizona Mortar Board Hall of Fame in 1981, which recognizes outstanding leadership and service. After her retirement, she was inducted into the National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics Hall of Fame in 1995. She continued to serve on committees and was an active member of University of Arizona athletics until her death on 30 January 2012.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into five series

list.item: Series II: University of Arizona Women’s Athletics, 1951-2010

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Mary Roby Papers document her early life and education, from her undergraduate years spent as a member of the Chi Omega Sorority at the University of Arizona to her professional life as an athletics administrator at the University of Arizona. Mary Roby’s leadership roles within the athletics department at the University are well recorded through photographic evidence and documents generated throughout the course of her career until her retirement in 1989. These records and photographs detail her legacy as an athletic administrator and document the history of women’s athletics.

relatedmaterial.p: University of Arizona Women's Athletics and Physical Education Papers, MS 555

scopecontent.p: Biographical materials include ephemera as well biographical summaries.

did.unittitle: Series II: University of Arizona Women’s Athletics,

scopecontent.p: The University of Arizona Women’s Athletics series contains annual reports, newsletters, newspaper clippings, historical data and a timeline of the history of women’s sports at the university.

Department of Athletics and Physical Education for Men,
University of Arizona Legacy - Women’s Athletics,
University of Arizona Women’s Athletics Timeline,
University of Arizona Women’s Sports Legacy,

scopecontent.p: The Photographic series is extensive and includes photographs taken as early as 1927 and spans eight decades

did.unittitle: Slides and Script - University of Arizona Women's Athletics History Presentation,
University of Arizona Class of 1948 Reunion,
Naming of the Mary Roby Gymnastic Training Center,

scopecontent.p: The Scrapbooks series is comprised of five scrapbooks documenting Mary Roby’s life as an undergraduate at the University of Arizona, her professional achievements, the naming of the Mary Roby Gymnastics Training Center, as well as a scrapbook assembled posthumously of her funeral service and legacy.

did.unittitle: Chi Omega Sorority Years - University of Arizona,

scopecontent.p: The Awards and Memorabilia series contains pins, buttons, and other commemorative items from her tenure at the University of Arizona including a plaque awarded to her upon her retirement in 1989.
